1.text: Dishonest scales are an abomination to the LORD, but an accurate weight is His delight.

2.text: When pride comes, disgrace follows, but with humility comes wisdom.

3.text: The integrity of the upright guides them, but the perversity of the faithless destroys them.

4.text: Riches are worthless in the day of wrath, but righteousness brings deliverance from death.

5.text: The righteousness of the blameless directs their path, but the wicked fall by their own wickedness.

6.text: The righteousness of the upright delivers them, but the faithless are trapped by their own desires.

7.text: When the wicked man dies, his hope perishes, and the hope of his strength vanishes.

8.text: The righteous man is delivered from trouble; in his place the wicked man goes in.

9.text: With his mouth the ungodly man destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous are rescued.

10.text: When the righteous thrive, the city rejoices, and when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.

11.text: By the blessing of the upright a city is built up, but by the mouth of the wicked it is torn down.

12.text: Whoever shows contempt for his neighbor lacks judgment, but a man of understanding remains silent.

13.text: A gossip reveals a secret, but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence.

14.text: For lack of guidance, a nation falls, but with many counselors comes deliverance.

15.text: He who puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer, but the one who hates indebtedness is secure.

16.text: A gracious woman attains honor, but ruthless men gain only wealth.

17.text: A kind man benefits himself, but a cruel man brings trouble on himself.

18.text: The wicked man earns an empty wage, but he who sows righteousness reaps a true reward.

19.text: Genuine righteousness leads to life, but the pursuit of evil brings death.

20.text: The perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD, but the blameless in their walk are His delight.

21.text: Be assured that the wicked will not go unpunished, but the offspring of the righteous will escape.

22.text: Like a gold ring in a pigâ€™s snout is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.

23.text: The desire of the righteous leads only to good, but the hope of the wicked brings wrath.

24.text: One gives freely, yet gains even more; another withholds what is right, only to become poor.

25.text: A generous soul will prosper, and he who refreshes others will himself be refreshed.

26.text: The people will curse the hoarder of grain, but blessing will crown the one who sells it.

27.text: He who searches out good finds favor, but evil will come to him who seeks it.

28.text: He who trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous will thrive like foliage.

29.text: He who brings trouble on his house will inherit the wind, and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.

30.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise.

31.text: If the righteous receive their due on earth, how much more the ungodly and the sinner!
